DataElement.preferredName: Time Integer::1 Lesion Dimension Longest Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The longest axis measurement of a T1 lesion.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Any observable abnormal structural change in a bodily part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement is the determination of the size or magnitude of something.  It is also used ro refer to the result of this act.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/15/08   - Created to support curation of ACRIN GYN MRI data elements.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the primary or longest diameter measurement in millimeters used to calculate the longest bidimensional measurement for a lesion or tumor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
